titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that Members of the House are not immune from having their offices searched.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H961)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H1171)

bill.summary:
1/23/2007--Introduced.
Expresses the sense of the House of Representatives that, if there is an ongoing criminal investigation into the activities of a Member of the House, the Member's congressional office may be subject to searches and seizures by appropriate executive branch officials in possession of a valid court order.
